docs.lead_paragraph: Two young men charged in the shooting death of an Indianapolis pastor's pregnant wife gave brief answers to a judge's questions Tuesday during their first court appearance since their arrest.

headline.main: 2 Charged in Pastor's Wife Killing Say Little in Court

docs.lead_paragraph: Among indigenous people in Bolivia, women were likely to have more children if they were infected with roundworms

headline.main: Parasites Found to Influence Fertility in Women
headline.print_headline: Biology: Parasites Found to Influence Fertility in Women

docs.abstract: Study in journal Science concludes that among indigenous people of Bolivia, women infected with roundworm are likely to have more children, while those invaded by hookworm are likely to have lower fertility rate.
docs.snippet: Among indigenous people in Bolivia, women were likely to have more children if they were infected with roundworms

docs.lead_paragraph: A Wisconsin law requiring doctors who perform abortions to have admitting privileges at a nearby hospital is unconstitutional, a U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday, addressing a topic the U.S. Supreme Court is considering during its current term.

headline.main: U.S. Appeals Court Rules Against Wisconsin Abortion Doctor Law
headline.print_headline: U.S. Appeals Court Rules Against Wisconsin Abortion Doctor Law

docs.snippet: A Wisconsin law requiring doctors who perform abortions to have admitting privileges at a nearby hospital is unconstitutional, a U.S. appeals court ruled on Monday, addressing a topic the U.S. Supreme Court is considering during its current term.

headline.main: Breast-Feeding Is Good for Mothers, Not Just Babies, Studies Suggest

docs.abstract: Breast milk may provide the ideal nourishment for an infant, but two recent studies are putting a different spin on the bottle-versus-breast debate.
docs.snippet: Breast milk may provide the ideal nourishment for an infant, but two recent studies are putting a different spin on the bottle-versus-breast debate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Planned Parenthood sued again Monday over efforts by Republican governors to block Medicaid funding to the nation's largest abortion provider, this time against Texas, where the organization says health care access to 13,500 women is on the line.

headline.main: Planned Parenthood Sues Texas Over Blocked Medicaid Dollars
headline.print_headline: Planned Parenthood Sues Texas Over Blocked Medicaid Dollars

docs.snippet: Planned Parenthood sued again Monday over efforts by Republican governors to block Medicaid funding to the nation's largest abortion provider, this time against Texas, where the organization says health care access to 13,500 women is on the line.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two Indianapolis men have been charged with the murder of a pastor's pregnant wife during an apparent home burglary, law enforcement officials said on Monday.

headline.main: Two Indianapolis Men Charged With Murdering Pastor's Wife
headline.print_headline: Two Indianapolis Men Charged With Murdering Pastor's Wife

docs.snippet: Two Indianapolis men have been charged with the murder of a pastor's pregnant wife during an apparent home burglary, law enforcement officials said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Grant Hasse was born with two very rare conditions — one that's usually fatal, the other that should have left him unable to talk.

headline.main: Born With No Voice & Low Odds, Boy Talks With New Voice Box
headline.print_headline: Born With No Voice & Low Odds, Boy Talks With New Voice Box

docs.lead_paragraph: It’s no small victory to hear Democrats and one Republican presidential contender talk about support for working parents.

headline.main: The Politics of Paid Time Off to Have a Baby

docs.lead_paragraph: Starting sometime in the next few months, California and Oregon will allow women to get a prescription directly from a pharmacist, a move that advocates hope becomes a national model.

headline.main: States Lead Effort to Let Pharmacists Prescribe Birth Control
headline.print_headline: California and Oregon Lead Effort to Let Pharmacists Prescribe Birth Control

docs.abstract: California and Oregon move to allow pharmacists to provide contraceptives to women without doctor's prescription; measure is seen by bipartisan supporters as step toward goal of reducing unintended pregnancies, especially among low-income women, and hopes are that more states will adopt such laws.
docs.snippet: Starting sometime in the next few months, California and Oregon will allow women to get a prescription directly from a pharmacist, a move that advocates hope becomes a national model.
